text:
1. Sure!
2. Since my first "big" console was PSX, I grew up with Tekken and also Soul Blade/Calibur. However I was lucky enough to try SFA3 and got hooked to Street Fighter, which became my favourite fighting series by far! SFIV is one of my favourite games of all time (and perhaps the one I've played the most!)
3. Many options here, but I tend to like versions of Cammy's theme (specially the one in SFA3)
4. Ryu for sure (my PS3's avatar), but because of being Spanish, Vega is a nice second

author: swoosh870

text:
1) I love fighting games. Just don't have the console to play them

2) At first, I was a SF player, having grown up with a Super Nintendo. Then I discovered the King of Fighter Series. I never looked back since, enven in its dark times.

3) Tough one... a tie between Ryu's and M.Bison's (US/Euro) I think.

4) This will get me a lot of insults: Ryu. Easy to learn, hard to master, very often considered the "noobie char" because of QCF+P spam. I don't, and in SF4, I'm quite good with him.

author: crithon

text:
1. I like a lot of fighting games, just haven't gotten into a bunch of the most recent entries in the genre.
2. If Smash Brothers doesn't count, then Bloody Roar is my favorite fighting game series. Absolutely fell in love with Bakuryu, the mole.
3. My favorite SF song is Vega's Theme. Just gets the blood pumping as he's flying at you from all over the place on his cage.
4. My favorite original character is Ryu. Hadouken FTW! Dhalsim is a close second simply because of his Yoga Noogie.

text:
1: Yeah, for some reason, fighting games relax me... 
2: This is a pretty weird answer: Kirby Superstar Ultra. It may not be that much of a fighting game, but I still love it... The game felt action-packed from beginning to end (odd, since the main character is a cute pink Puffball), and the Final Boss made me panic. And, for some reason, I feel the urge to win the Helper-To-Hero game with all 20+ Helpers.
